sen.j: 回転寿司（かいてんずし）とは、各種の寿司を載せた小皿を客席沿いに設置されたチェーンコンベア上に連続して循環させ、客は寿司を皿ごと自由に取り上げる、半セルフサービス型の安価な寿司屋の形態。
sen.e: Kaitenzushi is a type of inexpensive semi-self-service sushi restaurant where various kinds of sushi on small plates are rotating continuously on the conveyer chain placed along the counter seats.
Kaitenzushi is a type of inexpensive semi-self-service sushi restaurant where various kinds of sushi on small plates are traveling continuously on the conveyer belt passing along the counter seats.
Kaitenzushi is a type of inexpensive semi-self-service sushi restaurant where various kinds of sushi on small plates are traveling continuously on the conveyer belt passing along the counter seats.

sen.j: 精算は通常、皿の柄によって値段が決まり（均一値段の場合もある）、枚数を数えることで行う。
sen.e: Normally the prices are determined depending on the patterns of plates (uniform price in some restaurants) and calculated by counting the number of plates of the consumed sushi.
Normally prices are determined according to the patterns of the plates (uniform price in some restaurants) and calculated by counting the number of plates of the consumed sushi.
Normally prices are determined according to the patterns of the plates (uniform price in some restaurants) and calculated by counting the number of plates of the consumed sushi.

sen.j: 一部の寿司や汁物、飲み物は客が店員に直接注文しなければならない場合がある。
sen.e: Some sushi, soups and drinks which are not rotating on the conveyer belt, are to be ordered directly to the shop staff.
Some sushi, soup, and drinks not traveling on the conveyer belt, can be ordered directly from the shop staff.
Some sushi, soup, and drinks not traveling on the conveyer belt, can be ordered directly from the shop staff.

sen.j: また、回っている寿司であっても、直接頼んで握ってもらう（もしくは、コンベアに流してもらう）ことができるお店もある。
sen.e: Also there are some shops where customers can directly order to make and hand over (or put on the conveyer belt) their desired sushi, even same kind of sushi are already rotating there.
Also there are some shops where customers can directly order to make and hand over (or place on the conveyer belt) their desired sushi, even same kind of sushi are already traveling there.
Also there are some shops where customers can directly order to make and hand over (or place on the conveyer belt) their desired sushi, even same kind of sushi are already traveling there.

sen.j: 液晶タッチパネルで客が注文すると、注文したものが流れてきて到着を知らせる店や、（その液晶には単に商品名が記載されているものの他、魚が海底で泳ぐ映像が流れ、目当ての魚を選択する事で注文が成立するというものがある）カウンター上部に湯飲みが回っているコンベアがあったり、カウンター内部に皿回収用のコンベアが別途回っている店がある。
sen.e: Also there are some types of shops where customers order using liquid crystal touch panel which inform the ordered item is floating out (there are some types of liquid crystal touch panels – just with menu on it, with swimming fish images in the sea to select desired fish to order, etc.), conveyer belt for the tea cups are placed on the counter, another conveyer belt is placed inside the counter tables to collect dishes.

Also there are some types of shops where customers order by using a liquid crystal touch panel showing the ordered item swimming (there are some types of liquid crystal touch panels – with a menu on it, showing swimming fish images in the sea to select desired fish to order, etc.), there is also a conveyer belt for carrying tea cups, and another conveyer belt is traveling inside the counter tables to collect dishes.

There are also shops where customers can order by means of a liquid crystal touch panel that informs them when the item they ordered has arrived by showing an image of their order swimming (there are some types of liquid crystal touch panels that display a menu showing images of fish swimming in the sea from which customers can select the fish they wish to order, etc.), as well as shops with a conveyer belt for carrying tea cups and those with a separate conveyer belt that travels on the inside of the counter to collect dishes.
sen.cmt: 「到着を知らせる」の訳抜けに対応しました。

sen.j: 回収コンベアがある場合は、皿の数は自動で計算され表示されるようになっている。
sen.e: In the shops with the conveyer belt for collecting dishes, the number of plates of the consumed sushi is counted automatically and the calculated price is displayed.
In the shops with the conveyer belt for collecting dishes, the number of plates of the consumed sushi is counted automatically and the calculated price is displayed.
In the shops with the conveyer belt for collecting dishes, the number of plates of the consumed sushi is counted automatically and the calculated price is displayed.

sen.j: 皿の数でもって自動的に福引をする施設のある店もある。
sen.e: There are shops with lottery machine that automatically gives chances for customers to hold a lottery by the number of plates.
There are shops with lottery machine that automatically gives chances to customers to hold a lottery according to the number of plates.
There are shops with lottery machine that automatically gives chances to customers to hold a lottery according to the number of plates.

sen.j: 皿を載せたチェーンコンベアは時計回りに回るが、これは、箸を持った右利きの人が取りやすいようにとの配慮によるものである（この逆に回るものも存在し、この場合は左利き人が取りやすい）。
sen.e: Conveyer chain is rotating clockwise with plates on it so that right-handed people holding chop sticks in their right hand can pick their selections easily from there (conveyer chain rotating anticlockwise also exists which is easier for left-handed people).

The conveyer belt is traveling clockwise with plates on it so that right-handed people holding chop sticks in their right hand can pick their selections easily from there (conveyer belt traveling anticlockwise also exists to make it easier for left-handed people).

The conveyer belt is traveling clockwise with plates on it so that right-handed people holding chop sticks in their right hand can pick their selections easily from there (conveyer belt traveling anticlockwise also exists to make it easier for left-handed people).

sen.j: 左右両方からやってくるものもある。
sen.e: Also there is a type that sushi on the plates are floating from both sides.
Also there is a type where sushi on the plates are traveling from both sides.
Also there is a type where sushi on the plates are traveling from both sides.

sen.j: 内回り外回りの両方からとることができる。
sen.e: In that case, customers can pick up them from both directions.
In that case, customers can pick them up from both directions.
In that case, customers can pick them up from both directions.

sen.j: ボックス席ではこのような考えはない。
sen.e: That is not the case with table seats.
That is not the case with table seats.
That is not the case with table seats.

sen.j: 寿司以外には、ケーキなどのデザート、フルーツ、唐揚げ、天ぷら、刺身、フライ、そば、茶碗蒸し、ビール、酒、飲茶などが回っていることがある。
sen.e: Except sushi, there are usually the other foods and drinks such as desserts like cakes, fruits, fried chickens, tempuras (Japanese deep-fried food), sashimi (fresh slices of raw fish), deep-fried foods, soba (buckwheat) noodles, Chawan Mushi (steamed egg custard dish), beers, rice wines, Yum cha, etc. on the rotating conveyer belt.

Besides sushi, there are usually other food and drinks such as desserts like cakes, fruit, fried chicken, tempura (Japanese deep-fried food), sashimi (fresh slices of raw fish), deep-fried food, soba (buckwheat) noodles, Chawan Mushi (steamed egg custard dish), beer, rice wine, Yum cha, etc. on the traveling conveyer belt.

Besides sushi, there are usually other food and drinks such as desserts like cakes, fruit, fried chicken, tenpura (Japanese deep-fried food), sashimi (fresh slices of raw fish), deep-fried food, soba (buckwheat) noodles, Chawan Mushi (steamed egg custard dish), beer, rice wine, Yum cha, etc. on the traveling conveyer belt.

sen.j: 客層に児童や高齢者を含んだ家族連れを想定している為か、わさびは控えめに握ってある店舗が多く、追加のわさび（これは無料）が回っていることもある。
sen.e: Probably because shops are expected families including children and elders, wasabi is often added moderately in sushi and sometimes additional wasabi (for free) is rotating on the conveyer belt.
Probably because shops expect families including children and elders, wasabi is often added moderately to sushi and sometimes additional wasabi (for free) is rotating on the conveyer belt.
Probably because shops expect families including children and elders, wasabi is often added moderately to sushi and sometimes additional wasabi (for free) is rotating on the conveyer belt.

sen.j: 全品100円の低価格が売りの「100円寿司」が増えている一方で、作りたてを選べるように、さらにコンベアにネタの写真が回っているだけの店など、特色を持たせる傾向が増えている。
sen.e: While '100 yen sushi' shops which features inexpensive price of every item 100 yen are increasing, shops are tend to have features, for example, that only pictures of fishes for sushi are rotating on the conveyer belt so that customers can eat freshly-made sushi of their selections.

While '100 yen sushi' shops featuring the inexpensive price of 100 yen for every item are increasing, shops are tend to have added features, for example, only pictures of fish for sushi are rotating on the conveyer belt so customers can eat freshly-made sushi of their choice.

While '100 yen sushi' shops featuring the inexpensive price of 100 yen for every item are increasing, shops are tend to have added features, for example, only pictures of fish for sushi are rotating on the conveyer belt so customers can eat freshly-made sushi of their choice.

sen.j: 皿の裏に二次元コードやICタグを付けることにより、鮮度管理（コンベア上を一定時間以上流れたままになっている寿司を回収する）、売れ筋分析（どのネタがよく売れているか分析し、欠品や廃棄を少なくする）、会計処理効率化（ICタグリーダーで皿を読み取れば、瞬時に正確に料金が計算できる）を行うなど、IT化も進んでいる。
sen.e: IT is introduced increasingly in there like attaching two- dimensional bar codes or IC tags on the undersides of plates to control the freshness by removing too long rotated sushi from the conveyer belt after a certain period of time, to analyze selling items to minimize shortage and disposal, to streamline billing by scanning the codes of plates with IC tag reader to calculate the prices quickly and accurately.

new features are increasingly introduced like attaching two- dimensional bar codes or IC tags on the undersides of plates to control freshness by removing sushi that is left too long on the conveyer belt, to analyze which items are selling to minimize shortages and disposal, to streamline billing by scanning the codes of plates with IC tag reader to calculate the prices quickly and accurately.

New features are increasingly introduced like attaching two-dimensional bar codes or IC tags on the undersides of plates to control freshness by removing sushi that is left too long on the conveyer belt, to analyze which items are selling to minimize shortages and disposal, to streamline billing by scanning the codes of plates with IC tag reader to calculate the prices quickly and accurately.

sen.j: 大阪の立ち喰い寿司店経営者・白石義明が、ビール製造のベルトコンベアをヒントに、多数の客の注文を低コストで効率的にさばくことを目的として「コンベヤ旋廻食事台」を考案し、1958年、大阪府布施市（現・東大阪市）の近畿日本鉄道布施駅北口に最初の回転寿司店である「元禄寿司」を開いた。
sen.e: Yoshiaki SHIRAISHI who was a proprietor of a standing-up-eating sushi restaurant in Osaka got a hit from a conveyer belt of beer production and invented 'rotating conveyer belt table' to serve a lot of orders effectively with lower costs and in 1958 opened the first Kaitenzushi shop 'Genrokuzushi' at the north exit of the Fuse station of Kintetsu in Fuse City of Osaka Prefecture (now Higashi Osaka City).
sen.cmt: 「コンベヤ旋廻食事台」の定訳不明
sen.e: Yoshiaki SHIRAISHI who was a proprietor of a stand-up-eating sushi restaurant in Osaka got an idea from a conveyer belt for beer production and invented 'rotating conveyer belt table' to serve a lot of orders effectively at a lower costs and in 1958 opened the first Kaitenzushi shop 'Genrokuzushi' at the north exit of Fuse station of Kintetsu in Fuse City of Osaka Prefecture (now Higashi Osaka City).

Yoshiaki SHIRAISHI who was a proprietor of a stand-up-eating sushi restaurant in Osaka got an idea from a conveyer belt for beer production and invented 'rotating conveyer belt table' to serve a lot of orders effectively at a lower costs and in 1958 opened the first Kaitenzushi shop 'Genrokuzushi' at the north exit of Fuse Station of Kintetsu in Fuse City of Osaka Prefecture (now Higashi Osaka City).

sen.j: 1962年12月6日に、「コンベヤ旋廻食事台」は「コンベヤ附調理食台」として白石義明名義で実用新案登録（登録第579776号）されている。
sen.e: On December 6, 1962, 'rotating conveyer belt table' obtained the Ultimate Model Right No. 579776 as 'cooking table with conveyer belt' in the name of Yoshiaki SHIRAISHI.
sen.cmt: 「コンベヤ旋廻食事台」「コンベヤ附調理食台」の定訳不明
sen.e: On December 6, 1962, 'rotating conveyer belt table' obtained the Ultimate Model Right No. 579776 as 'cooking table with conveyer belt' in the name of Yoshiaki SHIRAISHI.
On December 6, 1962, 'rotating conveyer belt table' obtained the Ultimate Model Right No. 579776 as 'cooking table with conveyer belt' in the name of Yoshiaki SHIRAISHI.

sen.j: 「元禄寿司」（元禄産業株式会社）は飲食店の名称として「まわる」「廻る」「回転」などを商標登録しており、後発の他店は「回転寿司」の名称を利用できない状況が続いていた。
sen.e: 'Genrokuzushi' (Genroku Sangyo Co.,) obtained Ultimate Model Rights for the words referring 'rotating' such as 'まわる or 廻る mawaru' '回転 kaiten' as a name of restaurant, therefore other restaurants could not use the word 'Kaitenzushi' in the names for newly open restaurants for a long time.

'Genrokuzushi' (Genroku Sangyo Co.,) obtained Ultimate Model Rights for the words referring 'traveling' such as 'まわる or 廻る mawaru' '回転 kaiten' for the name of the restaurant, therefore other restaurants could not advertise the word 'Kaitenzushi' for newly open restaurants for a long time.

'Genrokuzushi' (Genroku Sangyo Co.,) obtained Ultimate Model Rights for the words referring 'traveling' such as 'まわる or 廻る mawaru' '回転 kaiten' for the name of the restaurant, therefore other restaurants could not advertise the word 'Kaitenzushi' for newly open restaurants for a long time.

sen.j: 元禄寿司によると、「1968年に東日本では初めての回転寿司店が誕生した」ので仙台に伝わるのに10年を要したことになる。
sen.e: According to Genrokuzushi, 'the first Kaitenzushi restaurant in eastern Japan was opened in 1968', which means that it took 10 years until it came from western Japan.
According to Genrokuzushi, 'the first Kaitenzushi restaurant in eastern Japan was opened in 1968', which means that it took ten years to spread to western Japan.
According to Genrokuzushi, 'the first Kaitenzushi restaurant in eastern Japan was opened in 1968,' which means that it took ten years to spread to western Japan.

sen.j: 従来の寿司店の高級化傾向に対し、廉価さ、手軽さ、会計の明朗さで大衆客のニーズをとらえ、1970年代以降全国的に広まり、今ではファミリーレストランの競争相手にもなっている。
sen.e: While traditional sushi restaurants tended to be exclusive, Kaitenzushi restaurants have satisfied the needs of ordinary people by providing low price, convenience, simple billing and have spread nationwide since 1970's and have become the competitors of family restaurants.

While traditional sushi restaurants tended to be exclusive, Kaitenzushi restaurants have satisfied the needs of ordinary people by providing low price, convenience, simple billing, and have spread nationwide since 1970's and have become the competitors of family restaurants.

While traditional sushi restaurants tended to be exclusive, Kaitenzushi restaurants have satisfied the needs of ordinary people by providing low price, convenience, simple billing, and have spread nationwide since 1970's and have become the competitors of family restaurants.

sen.j: 1997年、元禄産業が飲食店における「回転」の使用を解放した。
sen.e: In 1997 Genroku Sangyo released the right of 'Kaiten' for a name of restaurant.
In 1997 Genroku Sangyo released the rights of 'Kaiten' for naming restaurants.
In 1997 Genroku Sangyo released the rights of 'Kaiten' for naming restaurants.

sen.j: 1990年代末に、イギリスのロンドンで回転寿司に人気が集まった。
sen.e: In the late 1990's Kaitenzushi became popular in London, England.
In the late 1990's Kaitenzushi became popular in London, England.
In the late 1990's Kaitenzushi became popular in London, England.

sen.j: 人気に拍車をかけたのはYo! Sushiというチェーン店で、1997年にロンドンソーホー地区で開業し、その後、イギリス国内に次々と開店。
sen.e: A restaurant chain, Yo! Sushi which started in Soho, London in 1997 opened one after another in England and boosted the popularity.
A restaurant chain, Yo! Sushi which started in Soho, London in 1997 opened one after another in England boosting popularity.
A restaurant chain, Yo! Sushi which started in Soho, London in 1997 opened one after another in England boosting popularity.

sen.j: 1999年にパディントン駅構内のプラットホーム上に回転寿司屋を出店したことで注目を浴びた。
sen.e: In 1999 it drew attentions by opening Kaitenzushi shop on the platform in the Paddington station.
In 1999 it drew attention by opening a Kaitenzushi shop on the platform at Paddington station.
In 1999 it drew attention by opening a Kaitenzushi shop on the platform at Paddington station.

sen.j: コンベアに並ぶのは寿司のほか、刺身、鶏の唐揚げ、餃子、日本酒など日本食を取り揃え、また紅茶、パン、ケーキ、フルーツ、あるいは唐辛子入り鶏ラーメンや焼きうどん、天ぷらまで揃えてメニューを工夫。
sen.e: Other than sushi, there are also various selections including Japanese foods and drinks such as sashimi, fried chickens, dumplings, rice wines and also teas, breads, cakes, fruits, chicken ramen noodles with red pepper, fried wheat noodles, tempuras.

Other than sushi, there are also various selections including Japanese food and drinks such as sashimi, fried chicken, dumplings, rice wine and also tea, bread, cakes, fruit, chicken ramen noodles with red pepper, fried wheat noodles, tempura.

Other than sushi, there are also various selections including Japanese food and drinks such as sashimi, fried chicken, dumplings, rice wine and also tea, bread, cakes, fruit, chicken ramen noodles with red pepper, fried wheat noodles, tenpura.

sen.j: 商品の値段を皿の色で区別する、日本と同様のシステムを採用している。
sen.e: The prices are determined depending on the patterns of plates as well as in Japan.
Prices are determined depending on the patterns of the plates like in Japan.
Prices are determined depending on the patterns of the plates like in Japan.

sen.j: 開業後大きな人気を呼び、創業者のサイモン・ウッドロフ（Simon Woodroffe）はイギリスの外食産業で大きな地歩を獲得したと報道されている。
sen.e: It became very popular since its opening and was reported that the founder Simon Woodroffe gained a large foodhold in the food service industry in the UK.
It became very popular since its debut and was reported that the founder Simon Woodroffe gained a large foodhold in the food service industry in the UK.
It became very popular since its debut and was reported that the founder Simon Woodroffe gained a large foodhold in the food service industry in the UK.

sen.j: 寿司について、週刊サンデータイムスが「ロンドンで最高」との折り紙を付けたこともある。
sen.e: The Sunday Times praised the sushi as 'the best in London'.
The Sunday Times praised the sushi as 'the best in London.'
The Sunday Times praised the sushi as 'the best in London.'

sen.j: 現在、ロンドン市内のハーベイ・ニコルズやセルフリッジなどの高級デパート内、さらにヒースロー国際空港内など20ヶ所以上の店舗を展開し、さらにフランスや中東のドバイにも進出したほか、2006年にも新店舗を開くと発表、アメリカ合衆国進出を狙っているとする指摘も少なくない。
sen.e: Now it has more than 20 shops including those in the luxury department stores in London such as Selfridges and Harvey Nichols and in Heathrow Airport and also developed in France and Dubai in the Middle East and announced that it will open new restaurants in 2006 and also it is assumed to open in the US.

Now there are more than twenty shops including those in luxury department stores in London such as Selfridges and Harvey Nichols and at Heathrow Airport and also developed in France and Dubai in the Middle East and announced that it will open new restaurants in 2006 and also it is assumed to open in the US.

Now there are more than twenty shops including those in luxury department stores in London such as Selfridges and Harvey Nichols and at Heathrow Airport and also developed in France and Dubai in the Middle East and announced that it will open new restaurants in 2006 and also it is assumed to open in the US.

sen.j: また、オーストラリアではスシトレインがチェーン展開している。
sen.e: In Australia there is a restaurant chain Sushi Train.
In Australia there is a restaurant chain Sushi Train.
In Australia there is a restaurant chain Sushi Train.

sen.j: 「タネ」と言う。
sen.e: It is called 'Tane'.
It is called 'Tane.'
It is called 'Tane.'

sen.j: また、職人が使う符丁として「ネタ」と逆に読んだ。
sen.e: Sushi chefs used to call it upside down as 'Neta' in their secret language.
Sushi chefs used to call it upside down as 'Neta' in their secret language.
Sushi chefs used to call it upside down as 'Neta' in their secret language.

sen.j: その種類は寿司寿司種を参照の事。
sen.e: Refer to Sushi Tane of Sushi for the kinds of toppings and fillings.
Refer to Sushi Tane of Sushi for the kinds of toppings and fillings.
Refer to Sushi Tane of Sushi for the kinds of toppings and fillings.

sen.j: 回転すしでは、本来寿司として使われない寿司種もあり、特殊なものや特別なものを挙げる。
sen.e: In Kaitenzushi there are toppings and fillings that are not used normally for sushi and here we list some particular examples.
In Kaitenzushi there are toppings and fillings that are not normally used for sushi and here we list some particular examples.
In Kaitenzushi there are toppings and fillings that are not normally used for sushi and here we list some particular examples.

sen.j: 巻物（べったら、しば漬、田舎漬、山ごぼう、梅しそ、納豆、穴キュウ（穴子＋きゅうり）、カツ、エビフライ）
sen.e: Makimono (rolled sushi) (Bettara pickles, Shiba-zuke pickles, Inaka-zuke pickles, mountain burdock, Japanese plum with beefsteak plant, Natto (fermented soybeans), conger with cucumber, cutlet, fried shrimp)

sen.j: 肉や揚物（牛カルビ、チャーシュ、ハンバーグ、ベーコン、チキン照焼、えび天、いか天、ししゃも天）
sen.e: Meat dishes and fried foods (short rib, char siu, hamburger, bacon, chicken teriyaki, shrimp tempura, squid tempura, shishamo smelt tempura)
Meat dishes and fried foods (short rib, char siu, hamburger, bacon, chicken teriyaki, shrimp tempura, squid tempura, shishamo smelt tempura)

sen.j: 太巻（かにマヨ、カリフォルニア、巾着、いなり、ばってら、押し寿司、バラ寿司、五目寿司）
sen.e: Futomaki (thick rolled sushi) (crab with mayonnaise, California rolls, Kinchaku (sushi wrapped in thin omelette), Inari (a pouch of fried tofu filled with sushi rice), Battera (pressed sushi topped with mackerel), Oshizushi (pressed sushi), Barazushi (a style of sushi where the topping is placed in a bowl over a bed of rice), Gomokuzushi (a style of sushi where ingredients mixed in the body of rice).

tit.j: 上場回転寿司とその店舗数
tit.e: Listed companies of Kaitenzushi and the number of restaurants
Listed Kaitenzushi companies and the number of restaurants
Listed Kaitenzushi companies and the number of restaurants

sen.j: ※「店舗」の（○○○）は、店舗数の時点。
sen.e: *(xxx) of 'restaurants' is the point of time counted the number of shops.
*(xxx) of 'restaurants' is the point of time the number of shops were counted.
*(xxx) of 'restaurants' is the point of time the number of shops were counted.

sen.j: （年/月）となっている。
sen.e: It is (year/month).
It is (year/month).
It is (year/month).

sen.j: 回転寿司店で寿司を回転させるコンベアは、ほぼ100%が石川県で製造されており、金沢市の石野製作所（販売は北日本カコー）が約60％、白山市横江町の日本クレセントが約40%を占める二強体制である。
sen.e: Almost 100% of the conveyer belts to rotate the sushi plates in Kaitenzushi restaurants are manufactured in Ishikawa Prefecture with the two strongest structure – about 60% by Ishino Seisakusho (distributed by Kitanihon-Kakoh) in Kanazawa City and about 40% by Japan Crescent.

Almost 100% of the conveyer belts that move sushi plates in Kaitenzushi restaurants are manufactured in Ishikawa Prefecture with the two strongest – about sixty percent by Ishino Seisakusho (distributed by Kitanihon-Kakoh) in Kanazawa City and about fourty percent by Japan Crescent.

Almost 100% of the conveyer belts that move sushi plates in Kaitenzushi restaurants are manufactured in Ishikawa Prefecture with the two strongest – about sixty percent by Ishino Seisakusho (distributed by Kitanihon-Kakoh) in Kanazawa City and about forty percent by Japan Crescent in Yokoe-cho, Hakusan City.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ補足しました。スペル

sen.j: 1974年に石野製作所が自動給茶機能付きコンベアを開発。
sen.e: In 1974 Ishino Seisakusho developed the conveyer belt with tea servers.
In 1974 Ishino Seisakusho developed a conveyer belt with tea servers.
In 1974 Ishino Seisakusho developed a conveyer belt with tea servers.

sen.j: 以後、湯呑搬送コンベア、特急（新幹線）レーン・スタッフレスコンベア（注文した品が通常と別のコンベアで搬送）、鮮度管理システム（一定の時間を経過した皿を自動的に排出）など、両社により新機構が開発されている。
sen.e: Since then, both companies developed conveyer belts with new functions such as conveyer belt for tea cups, Express (bullet train) Lane Staffless Conveyer (another conveyer belt to bring dishes quickly, while normal one is rotating in normal speed), freshness control system (removing too long rotated plates from the conveyer belt automatically after a certain period of time).

Since then, both companies developed conveyer belts with new functions for tea cups, Express (bullet train) Lane Staffless Conveyer (another conveyer belt to transport dishes quickly, while the normal one is rotating in normal speed), freshness control system (removing plates from the conveyer belt automatically staying too long after a certain period of time).

Since then, both companies developed conveyer belts with new functions for tea cups, Express (bullet train) Lane Staffless Conveyer (another conveyer belt to transport dishes quickly, while the normal one is rotating in normal speed), freshness control system (removing plates from the conveyer belt automatically staying too long after a certain period of time).

sen.j: ちなみに日本最長は147ｍ、日本最短は5ｍである。
sen.e: In fact, the longest conveyer belt is 147m and the shortest is 5m in Japan.
In fact, the longest conveyer belt is 147 meters and the shortest is five meters in Japan.
In fact, the longest conveyer belt is 147 meters and the shortest is five meters in Japan.

sen.j: 最近の回転寿司のチェーン店では、ネタ切れのないように店舗画像の抜き打ちチェックをしているところもある。
sen.e: Recently some Kaitenzushi chains audit the images of their restaurants without any notice if there are shortages of toppings.
Recently some Kaitenzushi chains audit the images of their restaurants without any notice to check if there are shortages of toppings.
Recently some Kaitenzushi chains audit the images of their restaurants without any notice to check if there are shortages of toppings.

sen.j: また、従来型の（チェーンコンベアを使わない）寿司店を、俗に「固定寿司」や「回らない寿司屋」という。
sen.e: Also the traditional type of sushi restaurants without conveyer chains are called 'fixed suchi' or 'not rotating sushi' in common speech.
Also the traditional type of sushi restaurants without conveyer belts are called 'fixed sushi' or 'stationary sushi' in common speech.
Also the traditional type of sushi restaurants without conveyer belts are called 'fixed sushi' or 'stationary sushi' in common speech.
